The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group Dear Parents, Hopefully you all had a wonderful break and are looking forward to all that Term Three has on offer! Last term was short but busy and now we are in our last term of the academic year. We had some awesome events in Term Two that everyone enjoyed such as: World Maths Day, Art Week, Russian celebration and ISM has Talent. We have lots of learning to do in our last term as well as enjoying the various events we have going on in Term 3. We are sure that Term Three will be as successful as the previous two, rounding the year off nicely. Summer Term Dates (12 weeks / 60 days) Monday 8th April - First day back. Tuesday 23rd April – After School Activities Begin. Thursday 2nd May – Lower School Music Concert Monday 6th May – Friday 10th May Half term (return Monday 13th May)
Tuesday 28th May – Golf begins (3 weeks) Monday 27th May – Friday 31st May (Assessment Week) Thursday 30th May – Art Exhibition Monday 3rd June – Thursday 6th June (Tottenham Hotspur Football camp) Tuesday 11th and Wednesday 12th June - Last days of ASAs Tuesday 2nd and Wednesday 3rd July - Parent-teacher Consultations 4-6pm Friday 5th July – Speech Day at the Hotel Marriott Grand Reminders: ISM is a ‘Nut Free’ school, please ensure that none of the snacks the children bring into school have nuts in them (this includes birthday cakes) and of course that they are healthy (no chocolate, sweets or crisps please). Thank you! In Year 1 we value the importance of protecting the environment and strongly advise parents to send their child to school with a water bottle every day. Also, please continue to wait outside for your child to come to you at the end of the day as the locker rooms get overcrowded when parents and drivers come in to help children get ready (Please remind your drivers of this). Uniform: Due to the weekly class uniform certificate I am glad to say that in general the children’s uniform has improved this year. Please continue to support us with this and refer back to the blue parent/student handbook to see exactly what your child should wear eg; black leather shoes except on PE days when trainers are to be worn. ICT: Please remind your children to use Purplemash.com at home and to complete the weekly ‘mymaths’ challenges that are sent home every few weeks. Also, don’t forget to check out the ‘App of the Week’ that is added to the weekly blurb. As always, many thanks to you for all your support and I hope that your children will enjoy their last term in Year 1! Yours Sincerely, The Year 1 Team, Mr. Rogers (Teacher 1A) Miss. Shiryaeva (TA) Miss. Candlish (Teacher 1B) Mrs. Celik (TA) Mr. Coburn (Teacher 1C) Miss. Ivanova (TA) Mr. Charlton (Year 1, 2 & 3 Phase Leader Mrs. Doubleday (Academic coordinator) Year 1 Curriculum coverage for this term Literacy Poetry: writing our own poems on the theme of animals. Reports: Identifying fact/fiction, recognising and recording factual information. Narrative: comparing and contrasting different versions of the same story ESL: Spelling and phonics skills, vocabulary improvement, appropriate use of past tense. Maths Counting in 10’s and ordering numbers to 100 and beyond, adding, subtracting and giving change, place value for 2 and 3 digit numbers, doubling, using different measures for estimating and comparing capacity, measuring time. We will also record information using pictograms and block graphs. PE The students will practice the basic skills of throwing, catching and hitting during a variety of modified games. During Athletics, the children will enhance their techniques in movement, allowing them to transfer these to a range of Athletic events. During OAA (Outdoor Adventurous Activities), the children will develop their understanding of how to solve a variety of problems by enhancing their communication skills and working together in small teams. ICT Understanding instructions and making things happen with basic control. Presenting information graphically with Pictograms. Integration of some IC units in the classroom. Music Children will be consolidating their knowledge, understanding and application of canon through singing rounds. They will be discovering new pitches and rhythms which they will learn to read from simple stave music, stick notation and hand signs. Children will be learning songs and composing music which link in with the sea topic. Russian Advanced & Intermediate: Letters and sounds (sound-letter analysis); words, sentences; reading and writing. Beginners: Russian ABC, Clothes and Simple sentences. PSHE Respect Keeping fit and healthy Keeping safe in the sun Self Appreciation How to keep ISM great! Presentations Integrated Curriculum (This subject combines skills from PSHE, Cultural Studies, Science and Humanities) Let’s Party! What does it take to throw a great party? This topic has the children becoming party planners learning a variety of skills and concepts in order to organize and hold the biggest, best Picnic Party ISM has ever seen. We will explore different parties around the world, different ways to celebrate a party and how light is used at parties. We will create games, a menu and a map to organise the day. The children will look at perspective in Art as well as make mats and hats for the party in DT. Safety as well as hosting responsibilities will also be looked at as will carrying out and recording a food survey in IT in order to make sure we have only the most popular food. DIVE, DIVE, DIVE!! All things living in the deep seas, studying and comparing them, examining life cycles, under water living things, different varieties of fish and identifying special features, caring for the coral reef.
